html/elements/!doctype.SUMMARY: A Document Type Declaration, or DOCTYPE, is an instruction that associates a particular SGML or XML document (for example, a webpage) with a Document Type Definition (DTD) (for example, the formal definition of a particular version of HTML). In the serialized form of the document, it manifests as a short string of markup that conforms to a particular syntax. Not including <!DOCTYPE> may trigger Quirks mode.

html/elements/!doctype/ja.SUMMARY: 文書型宣言（DOCTYPE宣言）とはSGMLやXML文書(webページなど)を文書型定義(DTD)(HTMLのバージョンごとの書式の定義など）と結びつけるためのものです。ドキュメントをシリアライズした書式中で、特定の構文にマッチするようにマークアップした短い文字列で指定します。<!DOCTYPE>を書かないとQuirksモード(互換モード)で表示されます。

html/elements/a.SUMMARY: Defines a hyperlink, a destination of hyperlink, or both.

html/elements/acronym.SUMMARY:
This element is deprecated in HTML5, in favor of the abbr element. It should no longer be used.

The acronym element indicated an abbreviation or a word formed by the initial letter or letters (or major parts) of a compound term, like NATO, radar or Interpol.

html/elements/acronym/ja.SUMMARY:
HTML5ではabbrが追加されており、この要素は非推奨となっています。今後はもう使うべきではありません。

<acronym>要素は、NATO(North Atlantic Treaty Organization)、レーダー（RAdio Detection And Ranging）、インターポール（the International Criminal Police Organization）などのような頭字語を表します。

html/elements/address.SUMMARY: The address element (<address>) encloses contact information of the owner or the author of the document or the article.

html/elements/address/ja.SUMMARY: <address>は文書や記事の所有者・著者とコンタクトをとるための情報を囲む要素です。

html/elements/applet.SUMMARY: The applet element (<applet>) embeds a Java applet into a web page.

html/elements/applet/ja.SUMMARY: <applet>はJavaアプレットをウェブページに埋め込む際に使用します。

html/elements/area.SUMMARY: Represents either a hyperlink with some text and a corresponding area on an image map, or a dead area on an image map.

html/elements/area/ja.SUMMARY: イメージマップ上でハイパーリンクとして設定されるテキストとエリア、またはハイパーリンクとして設定しないエリアを表します。

html/elements/article.SUMMARY: The article element (<article>) defines a self-contained composition within a page.

html/elements/article/ja.SUMMARY: <article>はページ内で単独で完結する構成要素を定義します。

html/elements/aside.SUMMARY: The aside element (<aside>) indicates content that is only tangentially related to the rest of the content.

html/elements/aside/ja.SUMMARY: <aside>はコンテンツの中のただの補足情報・余談であることを示します。

html/elements/audio/ja.SUMMARY: <audio>は音楽ファイルを再生したり、最低限のメディアプレイヤーのインターフェイスを表示するのに使用します。

html/elements/b.SUMMARY: The b element represents a span of text to be stylistically offset from the normal prose without conveying any extra importance.

html/elements/base/ja.SUMMARY: <base>は文書の基準となるURLを明示し、文書内の相対URLを解決するために使用します。.

html/elements/basefont/ja.SUMMARY:
basefont要素はページ全体のテキストのデフォルトとなるcolorやfont-sizeを明記するためのものです。 

basefont要素はHTML4で非推奨となったため、使用すべきではありません。（HTML5では廃止されています）

html/elements/bdi.SUMMARY: Represents a span of text that is to be isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting

html/elements/bdo.SUMMARY: The bdo element (<bdo>) allows you to specify the direction in which text is to be rendered on the page. ("BDO" stands for Bi-Directional Override.)

html/elements/bdo/ja.SUMMARY: bdo要素はページ上のテキスト表記の方向を定義することができます。（”BDO”とはBi-Directional Override（双方向オーバーライド）の略です。）

html/elements/bgsound/ja.SUMMARY: bgsoundはユーザがそのページにいる間、音楽ファイルを再生させるための要素です。 この要素を使用せず、代わりにaudio要素を使用してください。

html/elements/big.SUMMARY: The big element (<big>) indicates that the enclosed text should be display in a larger font size than surrounding text. This element is considered obsolete in HTML5. Use CSS instead.

html/elements/big/ja.SUMMARY: big要素はbigタグで囲んだテキストが周囲のテキストより大きく表示されるべきであることを示します。 HTML5ではもうほとんど使われていませんので、代わりにCSSを使ってください。

html/elements/blink.SUMMARY: Causes text to blink. This element is non-standard and deprecated; use CSS instead.

html/elements/blockquote/ja.SUMMARY: blockquote要素は拡張された引用を表します。

html/elements/body.SUMMARY: The body element (<body>) represents the main content of the document.

html/elements/body/ja.SUMMARY: body要素はドキュメントの主要コンテンツを表します。

html/elements/br.SUMMARY: The line break element, br, forces the current line of text to end and the text that follows it will being on a new line.

html/elements/br/ja.SUMMARY: 文章をbreakするbr要素はテキストを強制的に終わらせ、brに続くテキストを新たしい行に改めます。

html/elements/button/ja.SUMMARY: button要素はクリック可能なボタンを表示します。

html/elements/caption.SUMMARY: The caption (<caption>) element represents the title of the table that is its parent.

html/elements/cite.SUMMARY: The cite element represents a reference to a creative work.

html/elements/code.SUMMARY: The code element specifies a fragment of computer code.

html/elements/col.SUMMARY: The col element (<col>) specifies properties for each column within a <colgroup> element in a <table>.

html/elements/colgroup.SUMMARY: The colgroup element (<colgroup>) specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting. This element is useful for applying properties to entire columns, instead of repeating the properties for each cell, for each row.

html/elements/content.SUMMARY: The <content> element provides an insertion point into a shadow DOM tree.

html/elements/datalist.SUMMARY: The datalist element (<datalist>) represents a set of <option> elements that represent predefined options for other controls. It may be associated with an <input> element by adding a list attribute to the input element.

html/elements/dd.SUMMARY:
The dd element represents the description, definition, or value, part of a term-description group in a definition list (dl).

A dt (topic) is usually followed by one or more dd (definition) elements. Several consecutive dt are attributed to the dd element that immediately follows the group.

html/elements/del.SUMMARY: The del element indicates text that has been deleted from the document.

html/elements/dfn.SUMMARY: The dfn element indicates the defining instance of a term.

html/elements/dir.SUMMARY:
The dir element <dir> is used to list directory titles.

The dir element is deprecated in HTML 4.01, and obsolete in HTML5. Use CSS and the ul element instead.

html/elements/div.SUMMARY: The div element (<div>) is a generic block-level container that has no semantic value other than the one that you give it via id or class attributes. It can be used for a variety of purposes including the styling of common elements, or for grouping elements with common attributes.

html/elements/dl.SUMMARY: The dl element is used to define a description list. The element encloses one or more description terms, enclosed in dt elements, and description definitions (definitions of the terms), enclosed within dd elements.

html/elements/dl-old.SUMMARY: The <dl> element is used to define a description list. The element encloses one or more description terms, enclosed in <dt> elements, and description definitions (definitions of the terms), enclosed within <dd> elements.

html/elements/dt.SUMMARY:
The dt element indicates a definition term within a definition list (dl).

A dt (topic) is usually followed by one or more dd (definition) elements. Several consecutive dt are attributed to the dd element that immediately follows the group.

html/elements/element.SUMMARY: The element element defines a custom element. Note: This element has been deprecated, and is not supported by any browser. See document.register for the standard custom element definition.

html/elements/em.SUMMARY: The em element indicates text that has emphasis.

html/elements/embed.SUMMARY: The HTML <embed> Element represents an integration point for an external content- typically, non-HTML content such as an application or some other type of interactive content which involves use of a third-party plugin as a handler (rather than being natively supported by the UA).

html/elements/fieldset.SUMMARY: The fieldset element is used to group related fields within a form.

html/elements/figcaption.SUMMARY: The figcaption (<figcaption>) defines a caption or legend for a figure element. This element is new in HTML5.

html/elements/font.SUMMARY: The font element is an obsolete tag that was used to specify the typeface, size, and color of the text it contained.

html/elements/form.SUMMARY: The form element (<form>) defines an HTML form for user input, subsequently to be submitted to a website or service.

html/elements/frame.SUMMARY: The frame element (<frame>) defines one particular window (frame) within a <frameSet>. The <frame> element is obsolete in HTML5.

html/elements/frameset.SUMMARY: The frameset element (<frameset>) defines a collection of frames. The <frameset> element holds one or more <frame> elements. Each <frame> element can hold a separate document. The <frameset> tag is obsolete in HTML5.

html/elements/head.SUMMARY: The head element (<head>) represents a collection of metadata for the document.

html/elements/header.SUMMARY: The header element (<header>) represents the header of a section: a group of introductory or navigational aids.

html/elements/hgroup.SUMMARY: (Obsolete) The hgroup element (<hgroup>) is typically used to group a set of one or more h1-h6 elements — to group, for example, a section title and an accompanying subtitle. The hgroup element (<hgroup>) element is obsolete in HTML5.

html/elements/hn.SUMMARY: The h1 through h6 elements define levels of headings within a document.

html/elements/html.SUMMARY: The html element (<html>) represents the root of an HTML document. The <html> tag is the container for all other HTML elements; except for the <!DOCTYPE> tag.

html/elements/i.SUMMARY: The i element indicates that the contained text is in an alternate voice, mood, or language from the surrounding text.

html/elements/iframe.SUMMARY: The iframe element (<iframe>) introduces a new nested browsing context.

html/elements/input.SUMMARY: The input element (<input/>) is a multipurpose element for representing form widgets. The type of widget depends on the type attribute.

html/elements/input/type/button.SUMMARY: The button type of the input element represents a button with no default behavior. Compare with the button element which offers default behaviours with via attributes.

html/elements/input/type/checkbox.SUMMARY: The checkbox type of the <input> element represents a state or option that can be toggled.

html/elements/input/type/color.SUMMARY: The color type of the <input> element provides a widget for selecting a color value.

html/elements/input/type/date.SUMMARY: The date type of the <input> element represents a widget for specifying a date value (year, month, day), with no time zone or time information.

html/elements/input/type/datetime-local.SUMMARY: The datetime-local type of the <input> element represents a widget for setting a date-time value (year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds) with no time zone information.

html/elements/input/type/email.SUMMARY: The email type of the <input> element represents a field for entering an e-mail address.

html/elements/input/type/file.SUMMARY: The file type of the <input> element represents widget for specifying a file.

html/elements/input/type/hidden.SUMMARY: The hidden type of the <input> element represents a value that is hidden from the user, but which is sent with the form data; the value can be set programatically.

html/elements/input/type/image.SUMMARY: The image type of the <input> element represents an image. The user can either use the image as a button to submit the form, or select a coordinate of the image to be submitted with the form data.

html/elements/input/type/month.SUMMARY: The month of the <input> element represents a widget for entering a month value.

html/elements/input/type/number.SUMMARY: The number type of the <input> element represents a widget for entering a number.

html/elements/input/type/password.SUMMARY: The password type of the <input> element represents a one-line plain-text edit control for entering a password, which renders input text in such a way as to hide the characters (e.g., a series of asterisks).

html/elements/input/type/radio.SUMMARY: The radio type of the <input> element represents a radio button control.

html/elements/input/type/reset.SUMMARY: An input form button that resets the form to default values.

html/elements/input/type/search.SUMMARY: An input text field that is used for search queries.

html/elements/input/type/submit.SUMMARY: An input form button that submits the form data to the server.

html/elements/input/type/tel.SUMMARY: An input field intended for entering a telephone number; does not enforce any syntax.

html/elements/input/type/text.SUMMARY: The input element with a type attribute whose value is "text" represents a one-line plain text edit control for the input element’s value.

html/elements/input/type/time.SUMMARY: An input field for entering a specific time value.

html/elements/input/type/url.SUMMARY: An input field for entering a single, absolute URL value.

html/elements/input/type/week.SUMMARY: An input field for entering a value that represents a specific week.

html/elements/ins.SUMMARY: The ins element represents a range of text that has been inserted (added) into a document.

html/elements/kbd.SUMMARY: The kbd element denotes user input. Typically this is keyboard input (hence "kbd"), but it may also be used to represent other user input, e.g. voice commands or gestures.

html/elements/label.SUMMARY: Specifies a label for another element on the page.

html/elements/legend.SUMMARY: The legend element represents a title or explanatory caption for the contents of its parent fieldset element.

html/elements/link.SUMMARY: Enables the current document to establish links to external documents.

html/elements/listing.SUMMARY: (Obsolete) Renders text of the element (usually in monospace font) without interpreting contain HTML markup; obsoleted by pre and code elements.

html/elements/map.SUMMARY: Contains coordinate data for client-side image maps.

html/elements/mark.SUMMARY: Represents a run of text that is contextually-important for some reason, such as text that has been marked or highlighted.

html/elements/marquee.SUMMARY: Nonstandard. Defines a scrolling area (usually horizontal) of text.

html/elements/media.SUMMARY: Presents audio or video data to the user. The media element provides the audio and video objects which are used to play sound and video content.

html/elements/menu.SUMMARY: The menu element represents information as a list of items or commands.

html/elements/meta.SUMMARY: The <meta> element embeds various kinds of metadata that cannot be expressed using the title, base, link, style, and script elements.

html/elements/meter.SUMMARY: The HTML <meter> element represents a value within a specified range. This value can be any real number.

html/elements/nextid.SUMMARY: An identifier, automatically generated by the early NeXT web editor.

html/elements/noframes.SUMMARY: Recognized as a deprecated element. Intended to provide content for browsers that cannot, or are configured not to, display frames.

html/elements/noscript.SUMMARY: The HTML NoScript Element (<noscript>) defines a section of html to be inserted if a script type on the page is unsupported or if scripting is currently turned off in the browser.

html/elements/object.SUMMARY: The <object> element represents can represent an external resource, which, depending on the type of the resource, will either be treated as an image, as a nested browsing context, or as an external resource to be processed by a plugin.

html/elements/ol.SUMMARY: The ol element is used to define an ordered list. The element encloses one or more list items, enclosed in li elements.

html/elements/optgroup.SUMMARY: Allows authors to group choices logically in a select element.

html/elements/output.SUMMARY: The HTML <output> element represents the result of a calculation.

html/elements/pre.SUMMARY: The pre tag defines preformatted text. Text in a pre element is displayed in a fixed-width font and preserves both spaces and line breaks.

html/elements/q.SUMMARY: The q element represents some phrasing content quoted from another source.

html/elements/rp.SUMMARY: Used to provide fallback text to be shown by user agents that don't support ruby annotations

html/elements/rt.SUMMARY: The rt element marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation.

html/elements/s.SUMMARY: The s element represents contents that are no longer accurate and must be marked accordingly in order to allow keeping it in the document.

html/elements/samp.SUMMARY: The samp element represents output from a program or computing system.

html/elements/script.SUMMARY: The script element enables dynamic script and data blocks to be included in documents. It can contain code/data directly or it can link to external sources. It is mainly used with JavaScript.

html/elements/select.SUMMARY: The select element is used to create a drop-down list. Used with option tags inside the select element to define the available options in the list.

html/elements/small.SUMMARY: Presentational-only element to define text that will appear small. Used for fine print.

html/elements/source.SUMMARY: Allows developer to specify multiple alternative media resources for media elements, such as <video> and <audio>. It does not represent anything on its own, and is used with src attribute to specify the URL.

html/elements/span.SUMMARY: Groups inline elements in a document. The span element is both style and semantics neutral; it does not assign any style attributes or semantic meaning on its own.

html/elements/strike.SUMMARY: Deprecated presentational element defining strikethrough text. It is deprecated in HTML4 and not supported in HTML5. Consider the del or s elements instead.

html/elements/strong.SUMMARY: The strong element indicates text that is of great importance, seriousness, or urgency.

html/elements/style.SUMMARY: Defines style information for an HTML document. Inside the style element you specify how HTML elements should render in a browser. Each HTML document can contain multiple style tags.

html/elements/sub.SUMMARY: Defines subscript text. Subscript text appears half a character below the baseline.

html/elements/sup.SUMMARY: Defines superscript text. Superscript text appears half a character above the baseline.

html/elements/tbody.SUMMARY: The tbody tag is used to group the body content in an HTML table.

html/elements/td.SUMMARY: Defines a standard Cell in an HTML table.

html/elements/template.SUMMARY: Templates allow you to declare fragments of markup which are parsed as HTML, go unused at page load, but can be instantiated later on at runtime.

html/elements/textarea.SUMMARY:
The textarea tag defines a multi-line text input control.

A text area can hold an unlimited number of characters, and the text renders in a fixed-width font (usually Courier).

html/elements/tfoot.SUMMARY: The tfoot tag is used to group footer content in an HTML table.

html/elements/th.SUMMARY: The th tag defines a header cell in an HTML table.

html/elements/time.SUMMARY:
The time tag defines either a time (24 hour clock), or a date in the Gregorian calendar, optionally with a time and a time-zone offset. It does not render differently in any of the major browsers.

This element can be used as a way to encode dates and times in a machine-readable way so that, for example, user agents can offer to add birthday reminders or scheduled events to the user's calendar.

html/elements/tr.SUMMARY: The tr element represents a row of cells in a table.

html/elements/track.SUMMARY:
The track tag specifies text tracks for media elements (audio and video).

This element is used to specify subtitles, caption files or other files containing text, that should be visible when the media is playing.

Track is new to HTML5 and is not yet supported in any major browser.

html/elements/tt.SUMMARY: The teletype element (<tt>) creates monospaced text. It's use is deprecated in favour of semantic elements like <code> and CSS styles. However, the tt element is still widely supported in browsers.

html/elements/u.SUMMARY:
Underlines text inline.

Deprecated in HTML4, redefined in HTML5. In HTML5 it is used to express "an unarticulated, though explicitly rendered, non-textual annotation," such as a proper name in Chinese or a spelling error.

html/elements/ul.SUMMARY: The ul element is used to define an unordered list. The element encloses one or more list items, enclosed in li elements.

html/elements/wbr.SUMMARY: The Word Break Opportunity (wbr) element represents a position within text where the browser may optionally break a line, though its line-breaking rules would not otherwise create a break at that location.

html/elements/xml.SUMMARY: Defines a simple XML data that can be embedded directly in an HTML page.

html/attributes/atomicselection html att.SUMMARY: Specifies whether the element and its contents must be selected as a whole, indivisible unit.

html/attributes/accept.SUMMARY: This attribute supplies browsers with a hint about what filetypes its element will accept.

html/attributes/accesskey.SUMMARY: Sets a keyboard keystroke for selection of its element, which would otherwise be done using a mouse.

html/attributes/action.SUMMARY: Sets the URL which the browser will send the form data on submission.

html/attributes/align (table, iframe ele.SUMMARY: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the content in an element. Not supported in HTML5. Use CSS instead.

html/attributes/alt.SUMMARY: The alt attribute is used as a textual representation for graphics and buttons in browsers that don't or can't render images, or when the resource is not found.

html/attributes/async.SUMMARY: Provides additional control over when an external script or an HTML import is being fetched and executed while a document loads.

html/attributes/autocomplete.SUMMARY: The autocomplete attribute specifies whether a browser should automatically provide values for a form element.

html/attributes/autocomplete (input, for.SUMMARY: Specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off. When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.

html/attributes/autofocus.SUMMARY: Provides a way to direct a user to a specific field when a document loads.

html/attributes/background (body element.SUMMARY: Specifies a background image for a document. This attribute is deprecated in HTML4 and not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

html/attributes/background (table, table.SUMMARY: Specifies up to five separate background properties of an object.

html/attributes/bgcolor.SUMMARY: Specifies the background color of a document. This is deprecated in HTML4 and not supported in HTML5. Please use the CSS Background Color rule instead.

html/attributes/border.SUMMARY: Specifies the width of the border around an element. Deprecated in HTML4, not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

html/attributes/border (frameset, iframe.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the space between the frames, including the 3-D border.

html/attributes/cellpadding.SUMMARY: Specifies the space, in pixels, between the cell wall and the cell content. Not supported in HTML5. Use CSS.

html/attributes/cells.SUMMARY: Retrieves a collection of all cells in the table row or in the entire table.

html/attributes/ch.SUMMARY: Sets an alignment character. The first occurrence of the alignment character in each cell in a column will be on a vertical axis.

html/attributes/choff.SUMMARY: Removes an alignment character set by the attribute ch.

html/attributes/charset.SUMMARY: The charset attribute is used to declare the character encoding of the document.

html/attributes/class.SUMMARY: Specifies one or more classes for an element, usually used to point to a class in a style sheet.

html/attributes/classid.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the class identifier for the object.

html/attributes/codebase.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the URL of the component.

html/attributes/color.SUMMARY: The foreground color of the text of an object.

html/attributes/cols (frameset).SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the number of columns in the table.

html/attributes/contenteditable.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the string that indicates whether the user can edit the content of the object.

html/attributes/crossorigin.SUMMARY: Specifies the whether the script should expose error info. This may be used only when loading a cross-origin script.

html/attributes/datafld.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves a field of a given data source, as specified by the dataSrc property, to bind to the specified object.

html/attributes/datasrc.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the source of the data for data binding.

html/attributes/defer.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the status of the script.

html/attributes/encoding.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the MIME encoding for the form.

html/attributes/face.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the current typeface family.

html/attributes/formaction.SUMMARY: The formaction attribute specifies the URL of a file that will process the input control when the form is submitted.

html/attributes/formenctype.SUMMARY: The formenctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server.

html/attributes/formmethod.SUMMARY: The formmethod attribute defines the HTTP method for sending form-data to the action URL.

html/attributes/formnovalidate.SUMMARY: When present, it specifies that the <input> element should not be validated when submitted.

html/attributes/formtarget.SUMMARY: Specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.

html/attributes/height.SUMMARY: Specifies the height of the certain content elements in pixels.

html/attributes/hidden.SUMMARY: The hidden attribute is a boolean attribute. When specified on an element, it indicates that the element is not yet, or is no longer, directly relevant to the page's current state, or that it is being used to declare content to be reused by other parts of the page as opposed to being directly accessed by the user.

html/attributes/hspace.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the horizontal margin for the object.

html/attributes/is.SUMMARY: Describes the base element from which the element with this attribute is extended.

html/attributes/ismap.SUMMARY: Indicates that an image is part of a server-side image-map.

html/attributes/lang.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the language to use.

html/attributes/language.SUMMARY: Use the type attribute instead. Specifies the language of the script to be evaluated. May be omitted when using ECMAScript (also known as JavaScript).

html/attributes/link.SUMMARY: Enables the current document to establish links to external documents.

html/attributes/loop.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the number of times a sound or video clip will loop when activated.

html/attributes/lowsrc.SUMMARY: Allows authors to specify a lower resolution image to be shown while the actual image is downloading.

html/attributes/marginwidth.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the left and right margin widths before displaying the text in a frame.

html/attributes/max (htmlinputelement).SUMMARY: The max attribute specifies the maximum value for an <input> element.

html/attributes/maxlength.SUMMARY: The maxLength attribute sets an upper limit on the number of characters that can be entered in an input element.

html/attributes/multiple.SUMMARY: The multiple attribute indicates that the user is allowed to enter more than one value in an <input> element.

html/attributes/pattern.SUMMARY: The pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the <input> element's value is checked against.

html/attributes/placeholder.SUMMARY: The placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (e.g. a sample value or a short description of the expected format).

html/attributes/rel.SUMMARY: Describes the relationship from the current document to the anchor specified by the href attribute.

html/attributes/required.SUMMARY: The required attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, it specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

html/attributes/reset-style-inheritance.SUMMARY:
Indicates whether the inheritable CSS properties are set to the initial value established at the shadow boundary.

Deprecated -- do not use

html/attributes/select.SUMMARY: One or more tokens that define the matching criteria for the distribution of child nodes of the shadow host.

html/attributes/size.SUMMARY: This article outlines the HTML attribute "size", which allows the user to specify a width in characters of an <input> element.

html/attributes/srcset.SUMMARY: The srcset attribute is an extension of the image element. It provides additional image related information to the browser to help decide the most appropriate image to load. Most commonly used for delivering the best image for high device pixel ratio and responsive images.

html/attributes/standby.SUMMARY: A message for the browser to show while an object's implementation and data load.

html/attributes/step.SUMMARY: Specify the increment for input with types number, time, or range

html/attributes/style.SUMMARY: Sets an inline style for the element.

html/attributes/target.SUMMARY: Target is a link attribute, which defines where to open the link.

html/attributes/translate.SUMMARY: The translate attribute indicates whether the element’s content and attribute values should be translated or not.

html/attributes/width.SUMMARY: Specifies the width, in pixels, of certain content elements.

html/attributes/wrap.SUMMARY: Sets the wrap style (soft, hard, or off) for a text element.
